official-title.#text:
To amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to establish United States Immigration and Customs

			 Customs Enforcement

text.#text: There is established within the

a Director of

			 referred to as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: United States Immigration and Customs Enforcement

text.#text: There shall be at the head of

quote.#tail: ), who shall be appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate.

header.#text: Director of United States Immigration and Customs Enforcement

text.#text: The

have a minimum of five years professional experience in law enforcement, and a minimum of five
			 years management experience;

have the power to investigate and, where appropriate, refer for prosecution, any criminal violation
			 of Federal law relating to or involving—

border control and security, including the prevention of the entry or residence of terrorists,
			 criminals, and human rights violators;

customs, trade, or import or export control, including the illicit possession, movement of, or
			 trade in goods, services, property, contraband, arms, instruments of
			 terrorism, items controlled or prohibited from export, pornography,
			 intellectual property, or monetary instruments;
transnational money laundering or bulk cash smuggling;
immigration or naturalization;
gangs or criminal syndicates engaged in transnational criminal activity;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
e, or other violation relating to firearms,
			 explosives, or other destructive devices involving an alien;

text.#text:
the employment or abuse of an alien, including trafficking and peonage, labor violations, sexual
			 exploitation, pornography, prostitution, or sex tourism;
identification, travel, or employment documents;

unlawful use of personal information, including immigration document fraud, when such use relates
			 to or affects border security, terrorism, customs, immigration,
			 naturalization, trade, travel, or transportation security; and
travel security;
coordinate with Federal, State, local, tribal, and foreign agencies to promote the efficient—

investigation of criminal violations of the border security, terrorism, customs, immigration,
			 naturalization, trade, travel, and transportation laws of the United
			 States; and
civil enforcement of immigration laws, as such term is defined in
